Html:
Everytime I try and save the configuration I have created in the designer Visual Studio 2008 crashes, there is no error message it's just shuts down.
When I start it up again the changes in the designer has been saved but no .cs file is ever created.
I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling the Configuration Section Designer but it has made no difference. I am using Visual Studio 2008 Developer and Test edition with SP1 Beta.
I would really like to get this working as it looks really useful. Any help would be very much appreciated.

First of all, sorry for the delay in responding but I've been out for a couple of weeks. Unfortunately, I haven't seen that issue anywhere yet so I don't know what might be causing it. It might be related to the beta version of service pack 1, can you reproduce it on a machine without SP1 beta installed?

Thanks!

-Jelle

Jelle, same problem here. The error (in Dutch) is the following:

{System.InvalidOperationException: Het token StartAttribute in de status Content zou leiden tot een ongeldig XML-document.
   bij System.Xml.XmlTextWriter.AutoComplete(Token token)
   bij System.Xml.XmlTextWriter.WriteStartAttribute(String prefix, String localName, String ns)
   bij System.Xml.XmlWriter.WriteAttributeString(String localName, String value)
   bij System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.SerializeElement(XmlWriter writer, Boolean serializeCollectionKey)
   bij System.Configuration.ConfigurationElementCollection.SerializeElement(XmlWriter writer, Boolean serializeCollectionKey)
   bij System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.SerializeToXmlElement(XmlWriter writer, String elementName)
   bij System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.SerializeElement(XmlWriter writer, Boolean serializeCollectionKey)
   bij System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.SerializeToXmlElement(XmlWriter writer, String elementName)
   bij System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection.SerializeSection(ConfigurationElement parentElement, String name, ConfigurationSaveMode saveMode)
   bij System.Configuration.MgmtConfigurationRecord.GetConfigDefinitionUpdates(Boolean requireUpdates, ConfigurationSaveMode saveMode, Boolean forceSaveAll, ConfigDefinitionUpdates& definitionUpdates, ArrayList& configSourceUpdates)}
Maarten, if you don't also have a beta of the service pack, feel free to create an issue through the Issue Tracker and attach the project that shows the error.
Issue has been created (http://www.codeplex.com/csd/WorkItem/View.aspx?WorkItemId=3018), a reproducing project is on its way.
